title: 820-01598 5V ON AND OFF
message:
I GET 5.10V WITH 0.27A FOR 7 SECONDS THEN IT CYCLES AGAIN 

PPBUS_G3H = 12.23V
PP3v3_G3H = 3.30V
PP1V8_SLPS2R = 1.8V
PP1V8_AWAKE = 1.8V
PP1V1_SLPS2R = 1.1V
PP0V8_SLPS2R = 0.79V
PP3V3_AWAKE = 3.29V
PP1V2_AWAKE = 1.20V 
Could u3100 be bad

title: 820-01598 5V ON AND OFF
message: Test if is recognized in DFU mode.

title: 820-01598 5V ON AND OFF
message:
Any history available?
Both ports have the same behavior?

title: 820-01598 5V ON AND OFF
message: yes it shows 5v for 7 seconds then turns off and back on over and over

title: 820-01598 5V ON AND OFF
message:
Check and compare diode mode readings (with good board) on all big coils.
Test what happens with known good battery (holding some charge).

title: 820-01598 5V ON AND OFF
message:
i put a working board in to check battery and keyboard all good i charge the battery
when i put back bad board it works from battery but the tpe c closes to screen only says 5v and the other one 
no voltage when i take off battery it goes back to five volts is U3100 bad

title: 820-01598 5V ON AND OFF
message: the big coils on both board are the same

title: 820-01598 5V ON AND OFF
message:
Compare diode mode readings around U3100/200.
Pay atention to CC1/2 lines.

Changing U3100 is a good option; is that is the affected channel.
